[[Aztec calendar|2 Flint]] (1520) Cuitlhuac(IPA-eskwiˈtɬawak-Cuitlahuac1.ogg) (c. 1476 – 1520)For year of birth, see entry for"CUITLAHUAC",Dictionnaire de la langue nahuatl classique(Wimmer 2006).orCuitlhuac(in Spanish orthography;lang-nahCuitlāhuac,Wimmer (2006).IPA-nahkʷiˈt͡ɬaːwak, honorific formCuitlahuatzin) was the 10thtlatoani(ruler) of theAzteccity ofTenochtitlanfor 80 days during the yearAztec calendarTwo Flint(1520).Chimalpahin (1997): pp. 5657, 164165, 216217.

Cuitlhuac was the eleventh son of the rulerAxayacatland a younger brother ofMoctezuma II, the previous ruler of Tenochtitlan.Chimalpahin (1997): pp. 148151.His mother's father, also calledCuitlahuatzin ICuitlahuac, had been ruler ofIztapalapa,Chimalpahin (1997): pp. 4243.and the younger Cuitlhuac also ruled there initially.Chimalpahin (1997): pp. 5051.

Cuitlhuac was madetlatoaniof Tenochtitlan during theSpanish conquest of Mexico; After Pedro de Alvarado had ordered theMassacre in the Great Temple, the Aztecs were very upset and started to fight and put a siege to the Spaniards.Hernn Cortsordered Moctezuma to ask his people to stop fighting. Moctezuma told him that they would not listen to him and suggested Corts free Cuitlhuac so that he could convince them to dispose of their arms and not fight anymore. Corts then freed Cuitlhuac and once Cuitlhuac was free he led his people against the conquistadors. He succeeded and the Spaniards were driven out of Tenochtitlan on June 30, 1520. Cuitlhuac was ritually married to Moctezuma's eldest daughter, a ten- or eleven-year-old girl who later was calledIsabel Moctezuma.Chipman, Donald E. (2005). Moctezuma's Children: Aztec Royalty Under Spanish Rule, 15201700. Austin: University of Texas Press, pp. 40-41 ISBN 0-292-70628-6. OCLC 5713428

After having ruled for just 80 days, Cuitlhuac died ofsmallpoxthat had been introduced to theNew Worldby theEuropean ethnic groupsEuropeans. His elder brotherMatlatzincatzin, who had beencihuacoatl (position)cihuacoatl("president"), resigned upon Cuitlhuac's death.Probably from Chimalpahin (1997); broken reference.As soon as Cuitlhuac died,Cuauhtmocwas made the nexttlatoani.

The modernmunicipio (Mexico)Mexican municipalityofCuitlhuac, Veracruzand theMexico City MetrostationMetro Cuitlhuacare named in honor of Cuitlhuac. Theasteroid2275 Cuitlhuacis also named after this ruler.

There is an Avenue in Mexico City Called Cuitlhuac (Eje 3 Norte) that runs from Avenue Insurgentes to Avenue Mexico-Tacuba and that is part of an inner ring; also many streets in other towns and villages in Mexico are so called.
